title: Improve suggestion for misused str::get

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
Given the following code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=3fdf018c55f29ccc3e59f02acb689c83)):

```rust
fn main() {
    let s = "Hello World";
    let lo = 0_usize;
    let hi = 5_usize;
    let t = s.get(lo, hi).unwrap();
    println!("{t}");
}
```

The current output is long and includes a suggestion that doesn't fix my code:

```
error[E0277]: the type `str` cannot be indexed by `usize`
 --> src/main.rs:5:19
  |
5 |     let t = s.get(lo, hi).unwrap();
  |               --- ^^ string indices are ranges of `usize`
  |               |
  |               required by a bound introduced by this call
  |
  = help: the trait `SliceIndex<str>` is not implemented for `usize`
  = help: the trait `SliceIndex<[T]>` is implemented for `usize`
note: required by a bound in `core::str::<impl str>::get`

error[E0061]: this function takes 1 argument but 2 arguments were supplied
 --> src/main.rs:5:15
  |
5 |     let t = s.get(lo, hi).unwrap();
  |               ^^^     -- argument of type `usize` unexpected
  |
note: associated function defined here
help: remove the extra argument
  |
5 |     let t = s.get(lo).unwrap();
  |                  ~~~~
```

Ideally the output would be shorter and suggest the correct fix:

```
Error: string indexes should be a range, not two separate arguments

help: construct a range:
  |
5 |     let t = s.get(lo .. hi).unwrap();
  |                   ~~~~~~~~
```
